forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Drizzle likely. Cloudy, with a low around 47. South southeast wind around 8 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Drizzle likely before 10am, then rain. Cloudy. High near 55, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. South southeast wind 9 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In the stillness of the night, the air in Downtown San Francisco carries a sense of calm, punctuated only by the anticipated drizzle, under a blanket of heavy clouds. The temperature hovers coolly around forty-seven degrees, hinting at the dampness that will surely envelop the city as dawn breaks. As morning unfurls, those dark clouds will weep, transforming the delicate drizzle into steady rain, a full embrace of moisture that is expected to saturate the streets. With highs barely reaching fifty-five, the chill will precipitate a retreat into warmer layers, where scarves and jackets become both comfort and necessity.

The fog dances lazily along the shore, a gentle marine layer softening the once-clear outlines of the Golden Gate Bridge and the undulating silhouette of the cityscape. A brisk wind from the south adds a touch of bite, brushing against the skin as one ventures out. It might be wise to seek the warmth of a cozy café, perhaps with a steaming cup in hand, while watching the world move through a lens softened by rain. Alternately, a languid stroll through the city, flanked by the whisper of raindrops, may prove refreshing for the contemplative soul seeking an intimate embrace with the elements. In the embrace of such a day, the mundane glimmers with possibility, each drizzly moment transforming the landscape into a quiet oasis of reflection.
